intro: Lyncea hispida, commonly known as the hairy lyncea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
